alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 8:51PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 915 PM MDT... At 850 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Raton Crews Airport, or 14 miles southwest of Raton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton and Raton Crews Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 432 and 452. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 322 and 351, between Mile Markers 353 and 354, and between Mile Markers 356 and 361. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
